alert.note: Alert for Clark (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 08 at 9:36PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM MST/1245 AM PST/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by moderate rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arizona and southern Nevada, including the following counties, in northwest Arizona, Mohave. In southern Nevada, Clark. * WHEN...Until 145 AM MST /1245 AM PST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1033 PM MST /933 PM PST/, Doppler radar indicated pockets of moderate rain within a line from near Searchlight northeast across the Lake Mead National Recreation Area. Some of the higher rainfall totals were around Willow Beach. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bullhead City, Kingman, Mesquite, Boulder City, Laughlin, Colorado City, Overton, Las Vegas Bay, Lake Las Vegas, Moapa Town, Katherine Landing, Littlefield, Searchlight, Beaver Dam, Virgin River Gorge, Moapa Valley, Meadview, South Cove and Temple Bar Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
